root.SID:
This value shall be used to reference vehicle manufacturer specific record data identifiers and input/output identifiers within the server.
The vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU boot software identification record will be referenced using this value.The record data’s first byte will indicate the number of reported modules.
The vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU application software numbers will be referenced using this value.The record data’s first byte will indicate the number of reported modules.
The vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU application software numbers will be referenced using this value.The record data’s first byte will indicate the number of reported modules.
This value shall be used to reference the vehicle manufacturer-specific ECU boot software fingerprint identification record.
The vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU application software fingerprint identification record will be referenced using this value.
The vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU application data fingerprint identification record will be referenced using this value.The record data’s content and format is determined by the vehicle manufacturer and is specific to the ECU.
This value will be used to indicate the current active diagnostic session on the server. The specific session type will be defined by the “diagnosticSessionType” subfunction parameter in the DiagnosticSessionControl service.
This value will be used to reference the vehicle manufacturer’s specific spare part number.The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the vehicle manufacturer.
This value will be used to reference the vehicle manufacturer’s specific spare part number.The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the vehicle manufacturer.
This value will be used to reference the vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU (server) software version number.The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the vehicle manufacturer.
This value will be used to reference the system supplier’s name and address information.The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the system supplier.
This value will be used to reference the ECU (server) manufacturing date.The record data will be in the form of an unsigned numeric, ASCII or BCD format, and will be arranged in the order of Year, Month, Day.
This value will be used to reference the ECU (server) serial number. The record data’s content and format is determined by the server.
This value will be used to request the functional units that are implemented in a server.
This value will be used to reference the vehicle manufacturer’s order number for a kit,which is a collection of assembled parts purchased as a whole for production, such as a cockpit.
This range of values shall be reserved by this document for future definition of standardized server/vehicleIdentification options.
This value shall be used to reference the VIN number. Record data content and format shall be specified by the vehicle manufacturer.
This value will be used by reading services to reference the vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU (server) hardware number.The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the vehicle manufacturer.
This value shall be used to reference the system supplier specific ECU (server) hardware number.Record data content and format shall be server specific and defined by the system supplier.
This value shall be used to reference the system supplier specific ECU (server) hardware version number.Record data content and format shall be server specific and defined by the system supplier.
This value will be used to reference the system supplier’s specific ECU (server) software number.The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the system supplier.
This value shall be used to reference the system supplier specific ECU (server) software version number.Record data content and format shall be server specific and defined by the system supplier.
This value shall be used to reference the exhaust regulation or type approval number (valid for those systems which require type approval).
This value will be used to reference the system name or engine type. The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the vehicle manufacturer.
This value shall be used to reference the repair shop code or tester (client) serial number (e.g., to indicate the most recent service client used re-program server memory).
shall be unsigned numeric, ASCII or BCD, and the order shall be Year, Month, Day.
The date of the last programming of the server shall be referenced using this value. The format of the recorded data
The repair shop code or client serial number for the most recent calibration service shall be referenced using this value.
The date of the last calibration of the server shall be referenced using this value. The format of the recorded data shallbe unsigned numeric, ASCII or BCD, and the order shall be Year, Month, Day.
The software version used by the client to calibrate the server shall be referenced using this value.
The date of the ECU (server) installation in the vehicle shall be referenced using this value. The format of the recorded data shall be either unsigned numeric, ASCII or BCD, and the order shall be Year, Month, Day.
This value shall be used to reference the ODX (Open Diagnostic Data Exchange) file that will be used to interpret and scale the server data.
This value shall be used to reference the entity data identifier for a secured data transmission.

SID.Name: WDBI
SID.SUB-FUNC: The vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU boot software identification record will be referenced using this value. The record data’s first byte will indicate the number of reported modules.
The vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU application software numbers will be referenced using this value. The record data’s first byte will indicate the number of reported modules.
The vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU application software numbers will be referenced using this value. The record data’s first byte will indicate the number of reported modules.
This value shall be used to reference the vehicle manufacturer-specific ECU boot software fingerprint identification record.
The vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU application software fingerprint identification record will be referenced using this value.

The vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU application data fingerprint identification record will be referenced using this value. The record data’s content and format is determined by the vehicle manufacturer and is specific to the ECU.

This value will be used to indicate the current active diagnostic session on the server. The specific session type will be defined by the “diagnosticSessionType” subfunction parameter in the DiagnosticSessionControl service.

SUB-FUNC.Name: Vehicle Manufacturer Spare Part Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value will be used to reference the vehicle manufacturer’s specific spare part number. The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the vehicle manufacturer.

SUB-FUNC.Name: Vehicle Manufacturer ECU Software Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value will be used to reference the vehicle manufacturer’s specific spare part number. The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the vehicle manufacturer

SUB-FUNC.Name: Vehicle Manufacturer ECU Software Version Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value will be used to reference the vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU (server) software version number. The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the vehicle manufacturer.
This value will be used to reference the system supplier’s name and address information. The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the system supplier.

This value will be used to reference the ECU (server) manufacturing date. The record data will be in the form of an unsigned numeric, ASCII or BCD format, and will be arranged in the order of Year, Month, Day.
This value will be used to reference the ECU (server) serial number. The record data’s content and format is determined by the server.
This value will be used to request the functional units that are implemented in a server.

SUB-FUNC.Name: Vehicle Manufacturer Kit Assembly Part Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value will be used to reference the vehicle manufacturer’s order number for a kit, which is a collection of assembled parts purchased as a whole for production, such as a cockpit.
This range of values shall be reserved by this document for future definition of standardized server/vehicleIdentification options.
This value shall be used to reference the VIN number. Record data content and format shall be specified by the vehicle manufacturer.

SUB-FUNC.Name: Vehicle Manufacturer ECU Hardware Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value will be used by reading services to reference the vehicle manufacturer’s specific ECU (server) hardware number. The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the vehicle manufacturer.

SUB-FUNC.Name: System Supplier ECU Hardware Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value shall be used to reference the system supplier specific ECU (server) hardware number. Record data content and format shall be server specific and defined by the system supplier.

SUB-FUNC.Name: System Supplier ECU Hardware Version Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value shall be used to reference the system supplier specific ECU (server) hardware version number. Record data content and format shall be server specific and defined by the system supplier.

SUB-FUNC.Name: System Supplier ECU Software Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value will be used to reference the system supplier’s specific ECU (server) software number. The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the system supplier.

SUB-FUNC.Name: System Supplier ECU Software Version Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value shall be used to reference the system supplier specific ECU (server) software version number. Record data content and format shall be server specific and defined by the system supplier.

SUB-FUNC.Name: Exhaust Regulation Or Type Approval Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value shall be used to reference the exhaust regulation or type approval number (valid for those systems which require type approval).

SUB-FUNC.Name: System Name Or Engine Type Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value will be used to reference the system name or engine type. The record data’s content and format is determined by the server and is specific to the vehicle manufacturer.

SUB-FUNC.Name: Repair Shop Code Or Tester Serial Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: This value shall be used to reference the repair shop code or tester (client) serial number (e.g., to indicate the most recent service client used re-program server memory).
The date of the last programming of the server shall be referenced using this value. The format of the recorded data shall be unsigned numeric, ASCII or BCD, and the order shall be Year, Month, Day.

SUB-FUNC.Name: Calibration Repair Shop Code Or Calibration Equipment Serial Number

SID.SUB-FUNC: The repair shop code or client serial number for the most recent calibration service shall be referenced using this value.
The date of the last calibration of the server shall be referenced using this value. The format of the recorded data shall be unsigned numeric, ASCII or BCD, and the order shall be Year, Month, Day.

SUB-FUNC.Name: Calibration Equipment Software Number Data Identifier

SID.SUB-FUNC: The software version used by the client to calibrate the server shall be referenced using this value.

The date of the ECU (server) installation in the vehicle shall be referenced using this value. The format of the recorded data shall be either unsigned numeric, ASCII or BCD, and the order shall be Year, Month, Day.
This value shall be used to reference the ODX (Open Diagnostic Data Exchange) file that will be used to interpret and scale the server data.
This value shall be used to reference the entity data identifier for a secured data transmission.

SID.Name: DSC
SID.SUB-FUNC: On start , the ECU is by default session
Used to upload software
Used to unlock additional diagnostic functions, such as the adjustment of sensors.
Used to test all safety-critical diagnostic functions, such as airbag tests.
